meanings.definition: The quality or state of being wrinkled or corrugated.
meanings.sent1: The rugosity of the old map made it difficult to fold neatly.
meanings.sent2: I ironed the shirt to remove any rugosity before wearing it.
meanings.sent3: The rugosity of the crumpled paper made it look like a tiny mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The rugosity of the tree bark resembled the rugged terrain of a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The rugosity of the fabric felt like a bumpy road under my fingertips.

meanings.definition: A wrinkle or crease in a surface.
meanings.sent1: She smoothed out the rugosity in the tablecloth before setting the table.
meanings.sent2: The rugosity in the carpet showed where the furniture had been moved.
meanings.sent3: The rugosity in the bedsheet made it look like a crumpled paper sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The rugosity in the road caused the car to bounce along the uneven surface.
meanings.sent5: The rugosity in the fabric created interesting patterns when draped over the chair.

meanings.sent1: The rugosity of the rock made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent2: The rugosity of the tree bark provided a rough surface for insects to crawl on.
meanings.sent3: The rugosity of the sandpaper felt like tiny bumps under my fingers.
meanings.sent4: The rugosity of the road caused the bicycle ride to be bumpy and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The rugosity of the wall made it challenging to apply smooth paint evenly.
